data.chText: 动作；声音
data.enText: movement/sound

data.chText: 迈步；脚步声
data.enText: the act of lifting your foot and putting it down in order to walk or move somewhere; the sound this makes

data.chText: 婴儿学步
data.enText: a baby's first steps

data.chText: 他朝门口迈了一步。
data.enText: He took a step towards the door.

data.chText: 我们听见外面有脚步声。
data.enText: We heard steps outside.

data.chText: 步履
data.enText: way of walking

data.chText: 步伐；步态
data.enText: the way that sb walks

data.chText: 他迈着轻快的步子走着。
data.enText: He walked with a quick light step.

data.chText: 距离
data.enText: distance

data.chText: 一步（的距离）
data.enText: the distance that you cover when you take a step

data.chText: 再走几步就到了。
data.enText: It's only a few steps further.

data.chText: 他转身原路往回走。
data.enText: He turned around and retraced his steps (= went back the way he had come) .

data.chText: 她朝我靠近一步。
data.enText: She moved a step closer to me.

data.chText: 旅馆离海滩只有几步路。
data.enText: The hotel is only a short step from the beach.

data.chText: 系列；过程
data.enText: in series/process

data.chText: 步骤；措施
data.enText: one of a series of things that you do in order to achieve sth

data.chText: 这是向建立统一欧洲的目标迈出的第一步。
data.enText: This was a first step towards a united Europe.

data.chText: 你放弃工作搬到地球的另一端，可真不简单。
data.enText: It's a big step giving up your job and moving halfway across the world.

data.chText: 我们正在采取措施防止污染。
data.enText: We are taking steps to prevent pollution.

data.chText: 这虽不能解决问题，却是朝正确方向迈出的一步。
data.enText: This won't solve the problem but it's a step in the right direction .

data.chText: 这种新药的发现是治疗这一疾病的重大进展。
data.enText: The new drug is a major step forward in the treatment of the disease.

data.chText: 步；阶段
data.enText: one of a series of things that sb does or that happen, which forms part of a process

data.chText: 第一阶段完成后，你就可以接着进行第2步了。
data.enText: Having completed the first stage, you can move on to step 2.

data.chText: 我想把这一思想深化一步。
data.enText: I'd like to take this idea a step further .

data.chText: 这是他在事业上向前迈出的一大步。
data.enText: This was a big step up (= to a better position) in his career.

data.chText: 我来一步一步地给你解释。
data.enText: I'll explain it to you step by step .

data.chText: 自建房舍的分步骤指导手册
data.enText: a step-by-step guide to building your own home

data.chText: 台阶
data.enText: stair

data.chText: 台阶；梯级
data.enText: a surface that you put your foot on in order to walk to a higher or lower level, especially one of a series

data.chText: 她正坐在最下面一磴楼梯上。
data.enText: She was sitting on the bottom step of the staircase.

data.chText: 我们走下几级石阶，来到海滩上。
data.enText: We walked down some stone steps to the beach.

data.chText: 上几磴台阶就到了门口。
data.enText: A short flight of steps led up to the door.

data.chText: 舞蹈
data.enText: in dance

data.chText: 舞步
data.enText: a series of movements that you make with your feet and which form a dance

data.chText: 健身运动
data.enText: exercise

data.chText: 踏板操
data.enText: a type of exercise that you do by stepping on and off a raised piece of equipment

data.chText: 有氧踏板操
data.enText: step aerobics

data.chText: 踏板操训练班
data.enText: a step class

data.chText: 梯子
data.enText: ladder

data.chText: 折梯；梯子
data.enText: a stepladder

data.chText: 一架折梯
data.enText: a pair of steps

data.chText: 我们得踩着梯子才能爬到阁楼上去。
data.enText: We need the steps to get into the attic.

data.chText: 音乐
data.enText: in music

data.chText: 音级；度
data.enText: the interval between two notes that are next to each other in a scale
break step

data.chText: 走乱步伐
data.enText: to change the way you are walking so that you do not walk in the same rhythm as the people you are walking or marching with
fall into step (beside/with sb)

data.chText: （和某人）合上步伐，步调一致起来
data.enText: to change the way you are walking so that you start walking in the same rhythm as the person you are walking with

data.chText: 他赶上她，跟着她的步子往前走。
data.enText: He caught her up and fell into step beside her.
in/out of step (with sb/sth)

data.chText: （和某人）步伐一致（或不一致）；（和音乐）合拍（或不合拍）
data.enText: putting your feet on the ground in the right/wrong way, according to the rhythm of the music or the people you are moving with

data.chText: （和某人）想法一致（或不一致）
data.enText: having ideas that are the same as or different from other people's

data.chText: 她和同事们想法不一样。
data.enText: She was out of step with her colleagues.
mind/watch your step

data.chText: 走路小心
data.enText: to walk carefully

data.chText: 言行小心谨慎
data.enText: to behave in a careful and sensible way
one step forward, two steps back

data.chText: 进一步，退两步
data.enText: used to say that every time you make progress, sth bad happens that means that the situation is worse than before
a/one step ahead (of sb/sth)

data.chText: 避开（某人或某事物）；领先（某人或某事物）一步
data.enText: when you are one step ahead of sb/sth, you manage to avoid them or to achieve sth more quickly than they do
a/one step at a time

data.chText: 一步一步；逐步；按部就班
data.enText: when you do sth one step at a time you do it slowly and gradually

data.chText: 迈步；踩；踏；行走
data.enText: to lift your foot and move it in a particular direction or put it on or in sth; to move a short distance

data.chText: 上 / 下公共汽车
data.enText: to step onto/off a bus

data.chText: 我听见叫我名字时向前迈了一步。
data.enText: I stepped forward when my name was called out.

data.chText: 她闪到一边让他们过去。
data.enText: She stepped aside to let them pass.

data.chText: 我们小心翼翼地从碎玻璃上走了过去。
data.enText: We stepped carefully over the broken glass.

data.chText: 我一个急转身，踩到了他的脚上。
data.enText: I turned around quickly and stepped on his toes.

data.chText: 走进这家旅馆就像是回到了过去。
data.enText: Going into the hotel is like stepping back in time.
step into the breach

data.chText: 临时顶替某人工作；临时顶缺
data.enText: to do sb's job or work when they are suddenly or unexpectedly unable to do it
step into sb's shoes

data.chText: 接替某人的工作
data.enText: to continue a job or the work that sb else has started
step on it

data.chText: （尤用以要求加速驾驶）开快点，赶快
data.enText: used especially in orders to tell sb to drive faster
step on sb's toes

data.text: = tread on sb's toes at tread v.

data.enText: step out of line
be/get out of line

data.chText: 表现不好；不守规矩；越轨；出格
data.enText: to behave badly or break the rules
step aside/down

data.chText: 让位；退位
data.enText: to leave an important job or position and let sb else take your place
step back (from sth)

data.chText: 跳出（某事物的）圈子看问题
data.enText: to think about a situation calmly, as if you are not involved in it yourself

data.chText: 我们正努力学会走出自我的樊篱，认清我们自身的优势和缺点。
data.enText: We are learning to step back from ourselves and identify our strengths and weaknesses.
step forward

data.chText: 主动站出来（帮忙或提供信息）；自告奋勇
data.enText: to offer to help sb or give information
step in

data.chText: 居间调停；居中斡旋；援之以手
data.enText: to help sb in a disagreement or difficult situation

data.chText: 当地一位商人出面捐了一大笔款给学校。
data.enText: A local businessman stepped in with a large donation for the school.

data.chText: 运动队教练不得不介入，才使两个运动员没有动起手来。
data.enText: The team coach was forced to step in to stop the two athletes from coming to blows.
step out

data.chText: 出去
data.enText: to go out

data.chText: 我就出去一小会儿。
data.enText: I'm just going to step out for a few minutes.
step up

data.chText: 走上前去
data.enText: to come forward

data.chText: 她走上前去领奖。
data.enText: She stepped up to receive her prize.
step sth↔up

data.chText: 增加，提高（数量、速度等）
data.enText: to increase the amount, speed, etc. of sth

data.chText: 他为准备那场比赛加强了训练。
data.enText: He has stepped up his training to prepare for the race.

ex.chText: 正在采取措施防止该市出现酒后驾车。
ex.enText: Measures are being taken to prevent drunk driving in the city.

ex.chText: 民众要求制定新的食品安全措施。
ex.enText: New food safety measures are being demanded.

synonyms.bx: 尤指官方为解决某一问题而采取的行动。

ex.chText: 慢慢地，这变成了一种权宜之计而非必要的策略。
ex.enText: Gradually, this became an expedient rather than an indispensable tactic.

synonyms.bx: 指处理问题迅速有效的方法，即应急之策。

ex.chText: 福利制度改革的第一步
ex.enText: the first step in reforming the welfare system

ex.chText: 我们必须采取措施来结束这场战争。
ex.enText: We must take steps to end the war.

ex.chText: 我们正在采取措施以保护环境。
ex.enText: We are taking steps to protect our environment.

synonyms.bx: 指为处理某一问题或取得成功而采取的一系列举措之一，含有循序渐进之意，常用复数。

data.enText: break step

data.enText: to change the way you are walking so that you do not walk in the same rhythm as the people you are walking or marching with

data.enText: He caught her up and fell into step beside her.

data.chText: 我们正努力学会走出自我的樊篱，认清我们自身的优势和缺点。

data.enText: I'm just going to step out for a few minutes.

data.chText: 增加，提高（数量、速度等）
data.enText: to increase the amount, speed, etc. of sth

data.chText: 他为准备那场比赛加强了训练。
data.enText: He has stepped up his training to prepare for the race.

trans: 介入，干预，插手（棘手问题）
增加（数量）；提高（速度、强度等）

tr: any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
example: the situation called for strong measures
the police took steps to reduce crime

tr: the act of changing location by raising the foot and setting it down
example: he walked with unsteady steps

tr: a sequence of foot movements that make up a particular dance
example: he taught them the waltz step

tr: support consisting of a place to rest the foot while ascending or descending a stairway
example: he paused on the bottom step

tr: a solid block joined to the beams in which the heel of a ship's mast or capstan is fixed
a mark of a foot or shoe on a surface
example: the police made casts of the footprints in the soft earth outside the window

tr: a musical interval of two semitones
the sound of a step of someone walking
example: he heard footsteps on the porch

tr: the distance covered by a step
example: he stepped off ten paces from the old tree and began to dig

tr: a short distance
example: it's only a step to the drugstore

tr: relative position in a graded series
example: always a step behind
subtle gradations in color
keep in step with the fashions

tr: move or proceed as if by steps into a new situation
example: She stepped into a life of luxury
he won't step into his father's footsteps

tr: measure (distances) by pacing
example: step off ten yards

tr: place (a ship's mast) in its step
shift or move by taking a step
example: step back

tr: put down or press the foot, place the foot
example: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread
step on the brake

tr: walk a short distance to a specified place or in a specified manner
example: step over to the blackboard

tr: move with one's feet in a specific manner
example: step lively

tr: furnish with steps
example: The architect wants to step the terrace

tr: treat badly
example: This boss abuses his workers
She is always stepping on others to get ahead

tr: cause (a computer) to execute a single command

value.def: If you take a step, you lift your foot and put it down in a different place, for example when you are walking.

example.ex: I took a step towards him...
example.tran: 我朝他迈了一步。

example.ex: She walked on a few steps...
example.tran: 她继续走了几步。

example.ex: I followed her, five steps behind...
example.tran: 我跟着她，保持 5 步的距离。

example.ex: He heard steps in the corridor.
example.tran: 他听到走廊里有脚步声。

value.def: If you step on something or step in a particular direction, you put your foot on the thing or move your foot in that direction.

example.ex: This was the moment when Neil Armstrong became the first man to step on the Moon...
example.tran: 就在此刻，内尔·阿姆斯特朗成了首位登上月球的人。

example.ex: She accidentally stepped on his foot on a crowded commuter train...
example.tran: 她在拥挤的通勤列车上不小心踩到了他的脚。

example.ex: I tried to step back, but he held my upper arms too tightly.
example.tran: 我试图往后退，但他将我的上臂抓得太紧了。

value.def: Steps are a series of surfaces at increasing or decreasing heights, on which you put your feet in order to walk up or down to a different level.

example.ex: This little room was along a passage and down some steps...
example.tran: 这个小房间在沿着走廊再下几级台阶的地方。

example.ex: A flight of stone steps leads to the terrace.
example.tran: 一段石阶通向露台。

value.def: A step is a raised flat surface in front of a door.

example.ex: A little girl was sitting on the step of the end house...
example.tran: 一个小女孩正坐在最顶头那幢房子门前的平台上。

example.ex: Leave empty milk bottles on the step.
example.tran: 将空奶瓶放在门阶上。

value.def: A step is one of a series of actions that you take in order to achieve something.

example.ex: He greeted the agreement as the first step towards peace...
example.tran: 他称该协定是通向和平的第一步。

example.ex: She is not content with her present lot and wishes to take steps to improve it...
example.tran: 她对自己目前的生活并不满意，希望能采取措施改善它。

example.ex: The elections were a step in the right direction, but there is a lot more to be done.
example.tran: 举行选举是迈出了正确的一步，但仍有很多事情要做。

value.def: A step in a process is one of a series of stages.

example.ex: The next step is to put the theory into practice...
example.tran: 下一步是要将理论付诸实践。

example.ex: Aristotle took the scientific approach a step further.
example.tran: 亚里士多德将该科学方法向前推进了一步。

value.def: The steps of a dance are the sequences of foot movements which make it up.
Someone's step is the way they walk.

example.ex: He quickened his step...
example.tran: 他加快了步伐。

example.ex: There was a real spring in her step.
example.tran: 她的步子非常轻快。

value.def: If you stay one step ahead of someone or something, you manage to achieve more than they do or avoid competition or danger from them.

example.ex: Successful travel is partly a matter of keeping one step ahead of the crowd...
example.tran: 成功的旅行在某种程度上就是要比人群先走一步。

example.ex: Businessmen cluster together to get ideas, tips, personal contacts anything to get a step ahead of the computer.
example.tran: 商人们聚集在一起寻求创意、建议、人际关系等，以便能比计算机领先一步。

example.ex: ...nations only a few steps ahead of famine.
example.tran: 即将面临饥荒的各国

value.def: If people who are walking or dancing are in step, they are moving their feet forward at exactly the same time as each other. If they are out of step, their feet are moving forward at different times.

example.ex: They were almost the same height and they moved perfectly in step...
example.tran: 他们几乎一样高，而且走路时步调完全一致。

example.ex: They jogged in silence a while, faces lowered, out of step...
example.tran: 他们低着头，一言不发地慢跑了一会儿，步伐也不一致。

example.ex: She slipped her hand into his and fell into step beside him.
example.tran: 她轻轻地把手放进他的手心，和他并排而行。

value.tran: 步伐整齐/步伐不整齐;合拍/不合拍

value.def: If people are in step with each other, their ideas or opinions are the same. If they are out of step with each other, their ideas or opinions are different.

example.ex: Moscow is anxious to stay in step with Washington...
example.tran: 俄罗斯政府迫切希望和美国政府保持一致。

example.ex: The British Government is once more out of step with world opinion.
example.tran: 英国政府的观点再一次和世界舆论出现分歧。

value.tran: (想法、意见等)与…一致/与…不一致

value.def: If you tell someone to step on it, you are telling them to go faster or hurry up.

example.ex: We've only got thirty-five minutes so step on it.
example.tran: 我们只有 35 分钟了，快点。

value.def: If you do something step by step, you do it by progressing gradually from one stage to the next.

example.ex: I am not rushing things and I'm taking it step by step...
example.tran: 我不会仓促行事，我会一步一步地来。

example.ex: Follow our simple step-by-step instructions.
example.tran: 按照我们简单的说明，一步一步来。

value.def: If someone tells you to watch your step, they are warning you to be careful about how you behave or what you say so that you do not get into trouble.

trans: 介入，干预，插手（棘手问题）
增加（数量）；提高（速度、强度等）
步进马达；步进电机；步进电动机；步进微电机；步级马达
小心脚下；当心你的脚下；小心你的脚下
